titleStmt.title: Catalogue of Tamil Manuscripts (BnF) by Velanguani Arokium

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: A partial catalogue of the Tamil manuscripts of the then Bibliothèque Royale (today the BnF) by Velanguani Arokium (Tamil Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam) from Pondicherry, handwritten in 1845.

The codex contains:
a title page (by Reinaud?) (U1a)
the catalogue proper, by Velanguani Arokium (U1b): first are described 27 manuscrits (numbered from 1 to 27), then the 38 Ducler manuscripts (numbered from 1 to 38)
additions to the catalogue by an unidentified hand (U1c): description of 9 manuscripts (numbered from 39 to 47, in continuation of the Ducler manuscript numbering, without being in fact, as attested by the provenance mentioned, Ducler manuscripts)
Description based on the digital images available on Gallica.

collation.desc: the front cover. Recto marbled. Shelfmark on verso.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Verso marbled.
3 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation.
11 folios = Catalogue. Library Arabic foliation 1-11. Arabic pagination [1-3], 4, 21. Verso blank.
1 folio = Title Page (additional). Library Arabic foliation 1-11. Pagination [1-2].
9 folios = Catalogue by Velanguani Arokium. Library Arabic foliation 2-10. Arabic pagination 4-19.
1 folio = Addition to catalogue. Library Arabic foliation 10-11. Pagination 20-21, [22].
9 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. Verso marbled.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: FR. NOUV. ACQ 5,443 (front cover, verso).

On trouve dans le journal intitulé l'institut (numero d'octobre, 1855, pag. 127 et suivant) une notice de mMr Ph. Vander Haeghen sur la langue tamoul, sur les principaux ouvrages rédigés dans cette langue &c
Reinaud (f[1]r).

Binding information in black pencil:
Volume de 11 Feuillets
11 Juin 1891 (f[1]r).

binding.p: Red leather covers. Shelfmark on spine and front cover, verso.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to February 1845 (U1, f1r) and to February 22nd, 1845 (colophon, U1, f10r36).
